intro: Psychotria leptothyrsa var. multifurca, commonly known as the multifurcate psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale green. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
